documents.document: @Rpatzz obviously, I didn't the first time either!!
@Rpatzz omg. I just realised I used the wrong wear in that last tweet. I'm an idiot.
@Rpatzz I love how Tybalt was all "you look good in red, you should where it more often" and then Toby blushes ❤️ #tobalt
@Rpatzz I started my Toby #4 re-read this morning. I was going to start something else, but I needed a comfort read instead.
@Rpatzz it probably saves time and utensils!
@Rpatzz coffee and cereal!? Was it any good or a disaster?
5 of 5 stars to The Rose and the Dagger by Renee Ahdieh https://t.co/5A38c0C2xj
On page 308 of 420 of The Rose and the Dagger, by Renee Ahdieh https://t.co/O52w2r4yB7
@Rpatzz Definitely some action parts to come - particularly at the end of the book.
@Rpatzz The first half of BoF is VERY romance heavy. But the second has a better action/romance balance. If that helps.
@Rpatzz working for you. Have you got a long way to go, or is it worth putting it down and coming back later?
@Rpatzz that's a shame. I always find books slightly disappointing when I'm desperate to read something else. Or maybe this one just isn't
@Rpatzz can't say I blame you for being Toby obsessed :)
On page 184 of 420 of The Rose and the Dagger, by Renee Ahdieh https://t.co/0ty63eryLS
@Rpatzz Keep me updated on your plans though - I might be at least up to book 5 when you start then :P
@Rpatzz Reading/re-reading Red Queen is a VERY good plan. I did that at the end of last year to prep for King's Cage.
@Rpatzz Also - last tweet for now - I'm SUPER glad you're enjoying the series as much as I do :)
@Rpatzz But I really want to keep going with you! I might start bk 4 on the weekend (although you'll probably have started bk 5 before then)
@Rpatzz woo! You've got more of them! I had to put a pause on my re-reads. I'm on a Renee Ahdieh binge at the moment.
@Airann11 @_amycarruthers I think the tent is still my fave overall. But that top hat is something special too!
@_amycarruthers @Airann11 there's a 5th cover in the UK! https://t.co/1HSHd4TQYx
4 of 5 stars to The Ocean at the End of the Lane by Neil Gaiman https://t.co/5JF95ERutL
@SGarberGirl I feel like I've been waiting for this day for a LONG time - so I have no idea how you feel right now.
Today I met @neilhimself and he was lovely! Thanks for visiting! https://t.co/GrRnOIyswP
@SGarberGirl Happy Australian Book Birthday!! 🎪🕰🌹👗 #Caraval
On page 69 of 248 of The Ocean at the End of the Lane, by Neil Gaiman https://t.co/xt7HtlfOX8
@hannahplusbooks that's an odd request...do you get a lot of unusual objects being required by guests?
@Rpatzz is very strong, so there's always a chance that they reflect her health.
@Rpatzz Spike being sick could totally hurt you too. I'm always sad when characters get sick. But yes, Luna's connections to rose-beings +
@Rpatzz *hugs* I know! In a way I like that the series doesn't shy away from death, but it still hits you too hard!
@KeelyC_ Of course you've already finished, lol. I'm glad it was a great read :)
@KeelyC_ Let me know how fabulous it is :P
@Rpatzz I started my re-read of A Local Habitation this morning :)
@Rpatzz I have issues with Sylvester sometimes. I like him, but his actions towards Toby can be so whishy-washy!
@Rpatzz You definitely have to try it out now!
@Rpatzz I guess it'd just be like having coffee flavoured oats!
@KeelyC_ YAY! I still haven't read it yet - and don't know when I will :(
@Rpatzz Lol - one reason to be thankful I don't have a coffee obsession.
@Rpatzz Yes, we find out more about her in this book.
@Rpatzz it's the 'kinda' part that hurts the most :(
@Rpatzz I know, right? Shame it didn't last long :(
@Rpatzz ah, you've got a full TBR pile then :) I'm lucky with the Toby books - I've got them all on my shelf, I just haven't read them all.
@Rpatzz I think I'll have to fast track my re-reads so I'll be up to new books at the same time as you, haha.
@Rpatzz Tybalt's been in every book I've read and his role gets bigger with each book. But it takes a while. Keep me updated with bk 4
@Rpatzz But I agree that she should have noticed she had people who wanted and loved her.
@Rpatzz I can't blame her for being a little anti-social and down on everyone. She lost 14 years of her life AND her child and partner.
@Rpatzz It was something like "She came back to us. She came back to me." It was in Tybalt's blood memories near the end.
@Rpatzz And yes, there is contact with her daughter, but I won't tell you when :P
@Rpatzz books that would make me say yes to that question.
@Rpatzz There was a line in book 1 from Tybalt that I only really registered AFTER re-reading and knowing their connections in future +
@Rpatzz Like what Tybalt thought Toby wasn't ready to know...
@Rpatzz yay! I really liked An Artificial Night - it sparked a lot of curious questions and new characters :)
@Rpatzz I adore Spike. And I love how Seanan gives Spike so much personality, it's great!
@Rpatzz she so adorable - and I love all her interactions with the Luidaeg.
@Rpatzz My big re-read plans this year are Toby, KD, Sarah Dessen.
@Rpatzz I recommend it! I love re-reading good books - I pick up on clues missed the first time :)
@AmyArleneO @Rpatzz the October Daye series by Seanan McGuire
@Rpatzz I can't believe there are only a few weeks to go!! 😃
@Rpatzz I love that there are lots of Toby books, but I keep trying to delay finishing the ones that are available already.
@Rpatzz that was me last year - I just couldn't get on a good run of YA. One or two, sure - but not a great run.
@Rpatzz nice. I started my Toby re-reads the other day. Well, I re-read R&R - I'm going to alternate between new books and re-reads 😛
@Rpatzz which one are you reading - still book 3?
@Rpatzz yeah, but he's no Tybalt!
3 of 5 stars to Holding Up the Universe by Jennifer Niven https://t.co/gcTAmRiJbA
On page 221 of 388 of Holding Up the Universe, by Jennifer Niven https://t.co/33AujaaMdM
On page 121 of 388 of Holding Up the Universe, by Jennifer Niven https://t.co/mEMY1io5NI
@KeelyC_ I don't know if I'll get to read it straight away either - but at least I've got a pretty copy on my shelf :P
@KeelyC_ I got mine through Booktopia too. It wasn't supposed to arrive until tomorrow, so I feel a little special 😛 @OfficiallyAlly
@KeelyC_ look what arrived today! https://t.co/Ap4AzSbFjv
@Rpatzz I came across sidhe is the Fever series, so I didn't struggle saying "she" in my head. But I'm so thankful for McGuire's guide!
@Rpatzz Which word is tripping you up?
When a favourite author visits the office, it's time to fangirl! Thanks for signing some books @ryangraudin… https://t.co/ljAj8pKNrR
@Rpatzz I hate when I'm jarred out of a sentence because I'm stumbling over a name again.
@Rpatzz language/species words - find a way to pronounce them that may not be 100% correct, but doesn't take away from the flow of the story
@Rpatzz As long as you're consistent with yourself, I think you can get away with it. Sometimes it's better to compromise on foreign +
@Rpatzz I was ok with 'Sidhe' because I'd seen it before in Karen Marie Moning's Fever series. But there are some tricky ones!
@Rpatzz I got them wrong all the time, the first time I was reading them. Like 'Luidaeg' or the 'Daoine' part of Daoine Sidhe.
5 of 5 stars to Fire Touched by Patricia Briggs https://t.co/0EKPiL4oNT
@SGarberGirl I'd almost convinced myself I only needed the UK edition...but I think I'm going to have to spoil myself and buy both US & UK.
@hannahplusbooks @divabooknerd @tonilehelena I think "Sure, Jan" is a Brady Bunch quote. Before or after "Marcia, Marcia, Marcia!"
@hannahplusbooks @librarychickD Lol - we have been through a few PMs lately. I think the country has started a national drinking game...
3 of 5 stars to The New Guy by Amy Spalding https://t.co/lZvMV39Kkr
3 of 5 stars to The Crown's Game by Evelyn Skye https://t.co/rlRAbYCz9e
@librarychickD thank you - I'm covered in glitter now, but I love it!
@librarychickD I've been away for the last couple of weeks, and my neighbour just gave me all our mail which included your fabulous card!
@alwaysupatnight thank you - for not only the book, but for helping extend my Christmas into 2017, haha https://t.co/4nRFvfDHFD
On page 154 of 416 of The Crown's Game, by Evelyn Skye https://t.co/KO3z6iosdb
@alwaysupatnight 80 new books and 104 overall, it wouldn't hurt to count the re-reads :-)
@alwaysupatnight I think I'll only make it if I count re-reads. I usually don't like to count them, but if I have my main goal set for +
@alwaysupatnight Lol - I'm going to try the 104 challenge this year, but I'm setting my Goodreads goal at 80 again...just in case!
@alwaysupatnight that's a shame that it's not as good as you hoped, but I'm still looking forward to them. I'll have to order the rest soon.
@alwaysupatnight yay, I'm so glad it arrived. My sister said something arrived for me the other day, but I won't find out until Tuesday.
@alwaysupatnight is Murder of Crows as good as Written in Red?
@alwaysupatnight take a few more days, but I got super hooked and read it on one!
@alwaysupatnight I managed to finish my challenge! I made it to one book over thanks to The Wrath & The Dawn. I though it was going to +
@alwaysupatnight Happy New Year! Xox
5 of 5 stars to The Wrath & the Dawn by Renee Ahdieh https://t.co/zYbcmviAAd
@AuthorABouchet I got Flynn and Carver, so between the two of us, we've got them covered!
@AuthorABouchet it's fantastic! I had to try out both roads from the start - just so I had all my options on the table 😘
@AuthorABouchet OMG - I love this!
